tool.name: IntaRNA
tool.description: fast and accurate prediction of interactions between two RNA molecules

exit_code.description: Error occurred. Please check Tool Standard Error
Error occurred. Please check Tool Standard Error

param.name: basepairs
param.label: Exact number of basepairs in seed
param.help: Exact number of perfectly paired bases in the seed region -p

param.name: max_unpaired_1
param.label: Max. Number of mismatches in the seed region in the first sequence

param.name: max_unpaired_2
param.label: Max. Number of mismatches in the seed region in the second sequence

param.name: seed_position
param.label: Seed position (query) comma separated
param.help: search for seed in binding RNA (e.g. ncRNA) in region between positions start,end (given in 5' to 3' direction counting from 1) -f

param.name: temp
param.label: Temperature for energy computation
param.help: Temperature in degrees Celsius used to rescale energy parameters -T

param.name: window_size
param.label: Folding window size target
param.help: Size of the averaging window in the local target RNA folding for the computation of accessibilities -w

param.name: max_basepair_distance
param.label: Max. basepair distance (target)
param.help: Maximal distance of two paired bases in the local target RNA folding for computation of accessibilities -L

param.name: energy_threshold
param.label: Energy threshold for output
param.help: Output only interactions with an energy below or equal to this energy in kcal/mol -v

param.name: suboptimal_results
param.label: Number of suboptimal interactions
param.help: Maximal number of suboptimal interactions that are predicted. Only suboptimal interactions not overlapping with any other predicted target RNA interaction site are reported -s

tool.help:
**What it does** IntaRNA is a program for the fast and accurate prediction of interactions between two RNA molecules. It has been designed to predict mRNA target sites for given non-coding RNAs (ncRNAs) like eukaryotic microRNAs (miRNAs) or bacterial small RNAs (sRNAs), but it can also be used to predict other types of RNA-RNA interactions.
Anke Busch, Andreas S. Richter, and Rolf Backofen IntaRNA: efficient prediction of bacterial sRNA targets incorporating target site accessibility and seed regions Bioinformatics, 24 no. 24 pp. 2849-56, 2008 Andreas S. Richter, Christian Schleberger, Rolf Backofen, and Claudia Steglich Seed-based IntaRNA prediction combined with GFP-reporter system identifies mRNA targets of the small RNA Yfr1 Bioinformatics, 26 no. 1 pp. 1-5, 2010
